alert.note: Alert for Clark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 5:59PM CDT until April 04 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR HANCOCK...SOUTHWESTERN MCDONOUGH...SOUTH CENTRAL LEE AND SOUTHEASTERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 558 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near West Point, or 11 miles southwest of Carthage, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Denver around 605 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Carthage, Bentley, Ferris, Burnside, Adrian, Fountain Green, Webster and Blandinsville. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Illinois...southeastern Iowa...and northeastern Missouri. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
